intro: Lens nigricans var. uniflora, commonly known as the single-flowered black bean, is a variant of the common bean species native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dark, glossy pods and a single flower per inflorescence, distinguishing it from other varieties. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being oval-shaped and slightly hairy. The seeds, which are black in color, are used in traditional cuisines and have been studied for their nutritional content.
